Description: Ostracon, fragment (2 pieces joined) from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved and bearing traces of a brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink. Text contains I Peter 2:20-21.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.43)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (107805) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/107805)
